summary: FDA ensures that imported seafood is safe to eat. If it suspects that products may violate U.S. laws, FDA can detain them at ports until the violation has been resolved—a process called an import alert. FDA’s goal is to sample at least one shipment of each product before removing it from alert status. We found that for 274 seafood products that FDA removed from import...
title: Imported Seafood Safety: Actions Needed to Improve FDA Oversight of Import Alert Removal Decisions
